channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: 7-Eleven to close over 400 stores in North America
item.description: The ubiquitous convenience store owed its recent revenue drops to inflation, declining cigarette sales and a shift in palates toward fresh food and specialty drinks.
item.content:encoded:
The ubiquitous convenience store owed its recent revenue drops to inflation, declining cigarette sales and a shift in palates toward fresh food and specialty drinks.

(Image credit: Angela Weiss)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: What the Harris campaign is doing to try to win over more Black men
item.description: Former President Barack Obama bluntly told Black men this week that they need to get over it if they "just aren't feeling the idea of having a woman as president."
item.content:encoded:
Former President Barack Obama bluntly told Black men this week that they need to get over it if they "just aren't feeling the idea of having a woman as president."

(Image credit: Andrea Ellen Reed for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Tamara Keith

item.title: Harris releases her medical report -- and uses it to raise questions about Trump
item.description: Vice President Harris' campaign is using the report to underscore the fact that she is younger than her Republican rival — who has not released much information about his health.
item.content:encoded:
Vice President Harris' campaign is using the report to underscore the fact that she is younger than her Republican rival — who has not released much information about his health.

(Image credit: Brendan Smialowski)
item.dc:creator: Elena Moore

item.title: A cheese shop owner in Florida describes recovery efforts after her shop lost power
item.description: NPR’s Scott Simon speaks to Louise Kennedy Converse, whose cheese shop in Sarasota, Fla., lost power during Hurricane Milton.
item.content:encoded: NPR’s Scott Simon speaks to Louise Kennedy Converse, whose cheese shop in Sarasota, Fla., lost power during Hurricane Milton.
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: Opinion: Remembering Ethel Kennedy
item.description: NPR's Scott Simon remarks on the legacy of Ethel Kennedy, widow of Robert F. Kennedy. She died Oct. 10 at the age of 96.
item.content:encoded:
NPR's Scott Simon remarks on the legacy of Ethel Kennedy, widow of Robert F. Kennedy. She died Oct. 10 at the age of 96.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: How to pass along religious traditions (without embarrassing your teenagers)
item.description: The Hindu holiday of Navaratri involves some complicated dance moves, passed down from parents to children. But as one mother discovered, the line between passing on cultural traditions and mortifying your teenager daughters can be perilously thin.
item.content:encoded:
The Hindu holiday of Navaratri involves some complicated dance moves, passed down from parents to children. But as one mother discovered, the line between passing on cultural traditions and mortifying your teenager daughters can be perilously thin.

(Image credit: Justin Kramon)
item.dc:creator: Justin Kramon

item.title: The war is in Gaza, but Palestinians in the West Bank are targeted with violence too
item.description: In the year since the Hamas-led attacks on Israel, the occupied West Bank has seen an increase in Israeli military raids and attacks by Israeli settlers. More than 600 Palestinians have been killed.
item.content:encoded:
In the year since the Hamas-led attacks on Israel, the occupied West Bank has seen an increase in Israeli military raids and attacks by Israeli settlers. More than 600 Palestinians have been killed.

(Image credit: Maya Levin for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Kat Lonsdorf

item.title: Why was a Kentucky judge killed? So far, it remains a mystery
item.description: The one-of-a-kind killing of a Kentucky judge, allegedly by the local sheriff, has shaken tight-knit Letcher County, leaving people baffled and unnerved as police try to figure out a motive.
item.content:encoded:
The one-of-a-kind killing of a Kentucky judge, allegedly by the local sheriff, has shaken tight-knit Letcher County, leaving people baffled and unnerved as police try to figure out a motive.

(Image credit: Arden Barnes for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Frank Langfitt

item.title: New rules should make methadone easier to get, but change is slow in many places
item.description: An effective treatment for opioid addiction is easier to get after the Biden administration changed rules. That's making a difference for some people battling opioid use disorder, but access is still limited.
item.content:encoded:
An effective treatment for opioid addiction is easier to get after the Biden administration changed rules. That's making a difference for some people battling opioid use disorder, but access is still limited.

(Image credit: Karen Brown/New England Public Media)
item.dc:creator: Karen Brown

item.title: The Cuyahoga River was so polluted, it used to catch fire. Now it's making a comeback
item.description: The plight of the river, which empties into Lake Erie at Cleveland, helped inspire the Clean Water Act. Now it attracts kayakers and anglers and could soon be removed from an EPA watchlist.
item.content:encoded: The plight of the river, which empties into Lake Erie at Cleveland, helped inspire the Clean Water Act. Now it attracts kayakers and anglers and could soon be removed from an EPA watchlist.
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman
